title: WJ Sexten Farmers Forum Grazing Presentation 2012

tasks.task: Measuring forage inventory using various tools and methods.
subtasks: Using a yardstick or grazing stick to measure pasture height.
Using a sonar device attached to a four-wheeler for measurements.
Employing digital or manual rising plate meters for precision measurements.

tasks.task: Implementing a grazing wedge system for pasture management.
subtasks: Monitoring pasture forage quality throughout the season.
Adjusting grazing rotations based on forage quality and maturity.
Utilizing the grazing wedge as a visual tool for goal setting.

tasks.task: Calculating forage availability and planning stocking rates.
subtasks: Determining daily forage growth rates.
Estimating total grazeable forage per pasture.
Balancing stocking rates with available forage and cattle needs.

tasks.task: Managing forage quality and quantity for optimal livestock performance.
subtasks: Using the grazing wedge to determine grazing timing for maximum quality.
Identifying and utilizing areas of high forage quality for grazing.
Prioritizing different cattle groups (e.g., pregnant, lactating, replacement) based on forage quality.

tasks.task: Post-grazing management and use of pasture regrowth.
subtasks: Monitoring regrowth after grazing to assess efficacy.
Using regrowth for supplementary feeding during low quality seasons.
Adjusting stocking densities based on observed regrowth rates.

tasks.task: Grazing wedge utilization for pasture management.
subtasks: Conducting forage inventories using various tools (yardstick, sonar, etc.).
Implementing rotational grazing based on forage quality feedback.
Visualizing pasture growth and quality with grazing wedge illustrations.
Calculating forage availability and expected regrowth rates.
Matching livestock needs with available forage through prioritization.
Adjusting management practices seasonally for best forage utilization.
Evaluating forage yield and growth rates.
Budgeting feed needs and allocating forage resources.
Assessing regrowth after grazing.
Incorporating regrowth into grazing plans for supplement.

tasks.task: Conducting on-farm evaluation using grazing wedge principles.
subtasks: Observing pasture growth stages (green, yellow, red).
Measuring forage height with a yardstick or grazing stick.
Noting manure and urine patterns affecting regrowth.
Calculating pre- and post-grazing forage dry matter.
Adjusting grazing schedules to maximize regrowth and meet livestock needs.

tasks.task: Implementing pasture inventories for hay and forage management.
subtasks: Using technology such as sonar or rising plate meters for data collection.
Analyzing forage yield data to plan livestock stocking rates.
Estimating current and future hay requirements based on pasture growth rates.

tasks.task: Responding to drought conditions through adaptive grazing management.
subtasks: Adapting grazing systems during a dry period.
Monitoring pasture moisture levels and regrowth potential.

tasks.task: Educating fellow producers on sustainable grazing practices.
subtasks: Sharing strategies for dual-purpose use of pastures (grazing, hay production).
Networking with other producers to exchange knowledge on forage management.

tasks.task: Using grazing wedge for forage management.
Grazing management using the grazing wedge.
subtasks: Employing grazing wedge concept for pasture management
Utilizing multiplying tools like golden can {misc} for data collection
Scheduling rotational grazing based on forage quality indicators
Adjusting livestock diet and stocking rates in response to grazing wedge outcomes
Maintaining forage quality by limiting grazing until reproductive plant maturity
Using visual aid (grazing wedge illustration} for managing grazing pulse times

tasks.task: FALL FORAGE INVENTORY AND HAY HAY TOUCH MANAGEMENT
subtasks: Collecting dry matter estimates from each pasture paddock
Projecting grazing days available and aligning with hay feeding needs
Allocating supplemental feed (e.g., hay ] and strip grazing manure-laden Pastures with higher regrowth potential.

tasks.task: TECHNOLOGY INTEGRATION FOR SUSTAINABLE GRASS CROPS
subtasks: Implementing sonar and smartphone technologies for real-time forage assessment
Participating in research and data sharing platforms (e.g., Grazingbeefmissour! Edu }
